oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Dyersburg Main Street
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Street scene looking north on Main Street. To the far right, a Confederate monument is shown. Photograph of postcard.

The dedication of the Dyersburg Confederate Monument occurred on April 6, 1905, the anniversary of the Battle of Shiloh. The Dawson Bivouac of Dyersburg spearheaded the effort to raise money for the monument. Speakers at the dedication included Maecenas Benton, Gov. Jeff Davis of Arkansas, Sen. Edward Ward Carmack, Sen. James B. Frazier, Col. Luke Finley, and Samuel Rankin Latta.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Looking Back at Tennessee Photograph Collection, 1890-1981
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Carts & wagons; Monuments & memorials; City & town life; Commercial streets; Buildings; Street lights
